name: The Twenty One Hundred - White
description:
Stitch Details:
"Cannon Shield" - The Nine O'Clock Gun Company shield (centre front)
"21:00" - The military time when the cannon is fired every day (left side)
"Nine O'Clock Gun" - Our team name (centre back)
"The Nine O'Clock Gun Company" - Printed (inside hat on the crown taping)
"The Nine O'Clock Gun Company" - Our Trademark Inner Patch (inside centre back)

Bucket Details:
Stretch Fitted (S/M & L/XL)
White Cotton Twill Fabric with Black Stitching
6 Panel, Flat Brim (shapable) with 4" Crown

Sizing Details:
S/M is best paired for head sizes of 7, 7 1/8, & 7 1/4
L/XL is best paired for head sizes of 7 3/8, 7 1/2, & 7 5/8

Shipping Details:
Items will be packaged and shipped within a week of placing your order.

BOOM!
Our third bucket is our own branded hat called 'The Twenty One Hundred.'

This lid shines a light on our Nine O'Clock Gun Company team - Co-owners Fraser Snelgrove and Richard Seymour and our designer Dylan Rekert. After a year of planning, everything finally came together like the cannon does every night at 21:00 - BOOM! Our concept of blending historic designs with modern style has come to fruition.

The Twenty One Hundred bucket is named after the military time when the cannon is fired every night. Our goal as a company is to mirror ourselves after the Nine O'Clock Gun: quality, strength, tradition - and like the cannon, do one thing very well.

Images courtesy of Vancouver Archives. @vanarchives

name: Vancouver Athletic Club 1920
description:
Stitch Details:
"V-wings" - Vancouver Athletic Club Raised Logo (centre front)
"1920" - The year which the track team wore this logo (left side)
"VAC" - Team Name (centre back)
"Vancouver Athletic Club" - Printed (inside hat on the crown taping)
"The Nine O'Clock Gun Company" - Our Trademark Inner Patch (inside centre back)

Bucket Details:
Stretch Fitted (S/M & L/XL)
Crimson Wool with Creme Felt Patch
6 Panel, Flat Brim (shapable) with 4" Crown

Sizing Details:
S/M is best paired for head sizes of 7, 7 1/8, & 7 1/4
L/XL is best paired for head sizes of 7 3/8, 7 1/2, & 7 5/8

Shipping Details:
Items will be packaged and shipped within a week of placing your order.

BOOM!
The Nine O'Clock Gun Company presents the Vancouver Athletic Club 1920 bucket!

This lid is a tribute to the mysterious Vancouver Athletic Club (VAC) which was established June 1, 1906. There are several photos in Vancouver Archives (@vanarchives) including several different VAC teams, but not much has been published about the club itself. We know their clubhouse was located at Dunsmuir and Beatty (the old Cambie Grounds) - it seems they had soccer, rugby, football, basketball and baseball teams, hosted boxing matches and had a track team. Legendary Olympic sprinter Percy Williams was a member of the VAC track team.

The VAC bucket has all of the elements of an official, custom made, authentic team cap with a modern fit and shape.

Images courtesy of Vancouver Archives. @vanarchives

name: Vancouver Beavers 1918
description:
Stitch Details:
"V" - Vancouver Beavers Raised Logo (centre front)
"1918" - The year which they wore this logo (left side)
"Beavers" - Team Name (centre back)
"Vancouver Beavers" - Printed (inside hat on the crown taping)
"The Nine O'Clock Gun Company" - Our Trademark Inner Patch (inside centre back)

Bucket Details:
Stretch Fitted (S/M & L/XL)
Dark Navy Cotton Twill Fabric with White Stitching
6 Panel, Flat Brim (shapable) with 4" Crown

Sizing Details:
S/M is best paired for head sizes of 7, 7 1/8, & 7 1/4
L/XL is best paired for head sizes of 7 3/8, 7 1/2, & 7 5/8

Shipping Details:
Items will be packaged and shipped within a week of placing your order.

BOOM!
Back by popular demand! We are ecstatic to bring you our second shipment of 'Beavers' buckets!

This lid is a tribute to Vancouver's first professional baseball club, the Vancouver Beavers. The Beavers started in 1908, and were bought by Bob Brown, also known as "Mr Baseball". The team played at 5th Avenue & Hemlock Street in Athletic Park for several seasons, but eventually folded in 1922. The logo represented on this bucket is similar to what was worn on their jersey in 1918.

The Beaver's bucket has all of the elements of an official, custom made, authentic team cap with a modern fit and shape.

Images courtesy of Vancouver Archives. @vanarchives
